message: any feedback/comments would be appreciated :)
My friend/colleague @awfy and I built this site in a day to try out node.js and to also just have some fun.
It's a real-time chat system which lets you quickly spark a conversation about anything, just head to http://prompt.im/<topic/channel_name> and start chatting.
You can check out the main channel here: http://prompt.im/prompt
That's really cool, is there some way of seeing the most populated channels to join?
@awfy's designs are so very good. That guy is really talented.
Brilliant.  I had a similar concept centered around doing this with Google Apps/Gmail compatible Jabber ID's, but Google's implmenentation of Jabber made it impossible.
do you guys test for IE?
Mine's open source though, not a startup-esque project
Very nice design. What's it built on?
You guys are a two man team yeah? Need a third? I'm kind of working on my own real time thing. (Aren't we all these days)
Oh you guys built interstateapp too
Interstateapp looks way cool, by the way. Just requested an invite and will definitely be using it for my projects!
That takes balls to promote a similar app to convore on convore seriously dude not cool I am not joining it for that reason
Doesn't work on iOS safari browser

@italiano40 It's no where near Convore. Prompt doesn't have groups, we only have topics/channels. You would use Convore for completely different reasons to why you'd use Prompt (which is why I still personally use Convore).
@Lloyd we're adding that in very soon :)
@gph that's odd - it works fine for most people.

@apphacker this is built on node.js and Interstate is built on PHP. Yeah, we're a 2 guy team but I don't think we're looking for a third person right now. Oh and we only test in IE 7/8+ but we're never *that* bothered if it doesn't work perfectly.
you have really great eye for design. it's really purrty for a speedy project. care to share some tips that you always use in your designs?
@simonify I saw on the roadmap that you're looking for a better markdown implementation in JS. Me too. :)
I sketched out the concept: http://jsonista.tumblr.com/post/4831645540/exposing-richer-data
ah
is it [IMG]xx.gif[/IMG] ?
You guys are unstoppable. :)
But Prompt is more for developers anyway
[IMG="http://../xx.gif"][/IMG]
I haven't used BBCode for years lol
yeah greg is good
making progress everyday though
it's going to be a real time forum
that guy is amazing
nm, convore mucked it up
https://github.com/apphacker/sphela is my project
I don't have a working demo yet
wish I had a designer on my team as good as @awfy
BBCode isn't /that/ much easier
@bat sounds awesome. Let me know if you release your implementation!
Asking mere mortals to create a link with an image in markdown on a regular basis is going to be a show stopper for any project. People will just not do it.
Not sure I agree with you. ;P
what's the syntax for a link with an image in markdown?
Screw markdown, I'm going to write a BBCode parser in JavaScript for my project. Markdown ftl
@simonify did you intentionally get the BBCode wrong to try and prove your point? ;)
no, you left off the right quote
lol
that was an accident :p
[IMG="http://../xx.gif"][/IMG]
kind of like phpbb that updates without refreshing
[IMG="http://../xx.gif"][/IMG] versus [](http://xx.gif)
or w/e the bbcode syntax is
millions use it on forums daily
Ah
yep...it certainly did ;)
Seems relatively broken on iPhone's safari.
awsome app, love it
Pretty sweet, good job!
This is great.  I'm curious about more of the internals...how are you persisting the messages?
Messages are delivered via socket.io and archived in a MongoDB collection

it's neat!  Have you seen http://anologue.com/ ? made me think of that a bit.
@italiano40 wtheck are you talking about? This project is not that similar to convore and even if it were, so what?  If someone makes a convore competitor, post it here and let each stand on its merit!
yup

Ever thought about pushing this as a Twitter-based IM for when you want to spark up a proper conversation with a twitter follower? Maybe throw in a 'Lloyd is inviting you to a quick chat on prompt.im' type thing? (since that's basically what I'm using it for)
Yeah, that's one of the main uses for the app. We're going to be adding twitter/facebook share options in the next few weeks.
@simonify Cool, that'll be very useful :)
Added a simple "Share to Twitter" button which appears at the top of a chat
*though
@simonify have you considered offering it as a saas white label solution? I think there is a market for that
We're looking in to offering (private) brandable channels (for a fee)
sounds good! :)
haven't really looked in to a white label model thought.
Yeah, it seems to
It's something I could use for 2 sites. Does the real time component work with ios too?
I haven't done any testing but people say it works fine on iOS
Great. I need to think about this for a bit, I'll send you some ideas in a couple of days if that is ok with you.

I'm working on a 'white label' real time forum thing, it's not a chat, but it could serve the same purpose. Mine is going to be open source, not charge anything for it. Of course mine doesn't have an existing prototype yet. I'm forced to build an admin interface along with the user interface so I can't make mine in a day. Plus I'm only one person with a full time job with a family. :P It will get there though, I'm committed to it.
